title.rendered: This is how you can pass an interview as a programmer at Google or Amazon

content.rendered:
Everything related to the world of programming and application development is more accessible to almost everyone than ever. Today many are preparing, in one way or another, to be a programmer desired by some of the big technology companies. For all this we can use a multitude of platforms and resources that will be of enormous help to us, as we will see below.

This is precisely the case that we are going to talk about in these lines thanks to a series of resources that will help you find a job as a developer. It is evident that to be a good programmer, the first thing you must do is put everything you need on your part. The additional elements that we can find on the internet will serve as support and help, but they cannot give us everything done. However, things today have changed a lot compared to just a few years ago in this software sector.

Becoming an app developer is more accessible than ever, but on many occasions it is also more demanding due to the competition. In addition, many users try to take advantage of their facet as an application programmer by looking for work in large companies such as Google, Amazon or Facebook, among many others. That is why we are going to show you a series of elements that will help you when it comes to finding a job in this regard.

Of course, as we mentioned before, these resources can help you, but we also need certain previous knowledge and desire to work. Here you can find some very important help elements such as tutorials, examples of technical questions, tips for the tests that will be presented, etc.

Find a job as a programmer more easily

Therefore, if you are looking for a job as a programmer in a more or less large company, we recommend you take a look at these resources that we show you.

Tech Interview Handbook: It may be the case that we have never conducted interviews of this type in the past. Therefore, this alternative that we are talking about is perfect in those circumstances. And here you are going to find a series of guides, practices and tips for the first interviews as a programmer. In addition, all this will even serve you for the tests proposed by the large companies related to technology.

DopplerHQ: Facing a job interview, whatever its type, is usually not easy for almost anyone. If you want to be part of the world of programming at a professional level, this resource offers you a good number of examples of technical questions. In addition, one of the advantages that we find is that these questions refer to multitude of programming languages and libraries of all kinds.

Jwasham: in this case we are going to talk about a useful study plan that will help you get a job as a programmer. This will help us to carry out various practical tasks in order to pass the dreaded professional interviews. All this will allow us to gain confidence and go more calmly, which always helps in the professional market.
